response.answer_text: It really depends on how you define a smartphone.According to Wikipedia, the first mobile smartphone to integrate digital display is invented by IBM back in 1992, which has the essentials of being a "phone" but not much more than that.    The modern smartphone however included various elements that traditional "phones" by definition don't have, and that's what makes it unique:Such as personal diaries, data logging, calenders, and Instant messaging (IM) etc.Which means, the first "smart" device would resemble that of a Personal digital assistant (PDA), which was first invented by Psion in 1984.  More modern smartphones then include features such as a touchscreen, the Global Positioning System (GPS) and internet connectivity (Wifi), among others. Even though these more modern smartphones pop up here and there in late 1990's to early 2000's, it isn't until a very eventful day where suddenly everyone gone crazy about smartphones. And that is in 2007, the release of Apple's first iPhone.   Hence now here we are in 2015, in a society with people constantly having their heads pointed down the restaurant table staring at his facebook page because a high school mate he hasn't talked to in years posted yet another new status update and totally ignoring that you're paying the tip for that meal as well as consoling his girlfriend that because he looks at his phone even when making love does not mean he does not love her.

The history of smartphone is almost 3 decades old and since then they have gone through a lot of changes to look like how they are now. Today the biggest names in the smartphone market are Apple and Samsung without a doubt. However, the smartphone inventor is none of these companies but is IBM. It was the year of 1992 when smartphone invented. IBM introduced their prestigious new device named the ‘Simon Personal Communicator. Considered as the first smartphone, this is the device that revolutionized the daily life of humans. Until then cell phones were solely meant for making calls. But Simon made it possible to send emails and faxes along with making phone calls. With around 50,000 devices sold in the early 90s, Simon was the first-ever smartphone to hit the market. Although, not close enough to the features of smartphones available today this device was costly and had extremely low battery life. If want to read the complete history of smartphones then I suggest you read the following article : Who invented the Smartphone ? Gadget that changed human life
